title: CGA Keen Dreams?
content:
I always tought that CGA versions were only made of Keen 4-6 and not of Keen Dreams or 1-3, however the included extra stuff with 1.01 and 1.31 shareware proves me wrong, as when you go to the section with more information about Gamer's Edge and scroll down a bit, you will come to the following text:
Attn CGA users: A CGA version of KEEN DREAMS is available! CALL US!

Does anyone here know whether this actually existed, or more importantly, does anyone have a copy of it floating around? I wonder if the CGA version also had a shareware version available...

title: Re: CGA Keen Dreams?
content:
Wow, never heard of this! It must be really rare!3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: CGA Keen Dreams?
content: Someone contacted Gamer's Edge to see whether they could confirm CGA Dreams existence, and they apparently claimed there is none. But then, nobody thought that the Keen 4 demo existed and that turned out to be real...

title: Re: CGA Keen Dreams?
content:
CGA KD can now be *made*

Wie ModkeenA proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.png[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: CGA Keen Dreams?
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Someone contacted Gamer's Edge to see whether they could confirm CGA Dreams existence, and they apparently claimed there is none. But then, nobody thought that the Keen 4 demo existed and that turned out to be real...[hr][/quote]

So you're trying to say that such a version did not exist after all? Darn... I wonder why they promoted it so much in both the 1.01 shareware and 1.13 if it didn't get done?

[quote]Quote:[hr]CGA KD can now be *made*[hr][/quote]

Yeah, but it wouldn't work on a real CGA computer right? It would need some changes in the game engine to make it so that only four colors can be used.

title: Re: CGA Keen Dreams?
content:
"Yeah, but it wouldn't work on a real CGA computer right? It would need some changes in the game engine to make it so that only four colors can be used."
Indeed. And it still wouldn't be an official one. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

It's likely there is one that everyone has just forgot. As someone said, just as Keen 4 demo version was..3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: CGA Keen Dreams?
content: who would want a cga keen :/

title: Re: CGA Keen Dreams?
content:
*raises hand*

I'm not particularly fond of CGA, but little things like this help make my Keening experience feel somewhat more complete. Another one of those unwordable things everthing Keenish seems to be laced with.

title: Re: CGA Keen Dreams?
content: Indeed. If it does exist, then my Keen collection wouldn't be complete without it. Just like the Keen 4 demo and how everyone was trying to find a copy of it.

title: Re: CGA Keen Dreams?
content: yeah i understand. It was stupid of me to ask. I have to agree. As much as i don't need it its cool to have a complete collection.
